result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis W Kirk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample/$250.00 DNA surcharge to probation.  Court costs $268.00 to probation.

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Cases called: 14CF589 & 14CF557, Defendant Travis W Kirk in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Joint sentencing agreement put on record. Statements by ADA Cross and Atty. Riek. Court sentenced defendant in each case, on each count, to 4 years prison, consisting of 1 year confinement followed by 3 years extended supervision. Counts run concurrent with each other. 14CF557 consecutive to 14CF589. Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program, is eligible for Challenge Academy Program. Sentence commences forthwith. Remaining financials converted to civil judgment. Jail credit:365 days in 14CF557 and 245 days in 14CF589
Appointed Attorney Amanda Riek
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 12, 2018 at 11:30 am.

Defendant, Travis W Kirk, appeared pro se. Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant motioned for good time and/or sentence credit. ADA Cross noted he is not eligible for either, as he is not sentenced. Court reitterated what the State said. Motion denied.

ADA Troy Cross appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in person in custody with Atty Peter Masana.  Rights/elements.  Preliminary hearing waived, probable cause found, bound over for further proceedings.  Information filed.  No contest plea to both counts in 14CF4557 (Ct 1, take w/o owners consent repeater and Ct 2:  felony bailjumping repeater ) and 14CF589  (Ct 1 felony BJ and Ct 2 felony BJ with repeater enhancer) .   Sentence withheld, placed on 4 years probation on each count.  in 14CF557,  Ct1, 9 months jail with huber commencing forthwith , AODA and comply, DNA sample, not to possess/consume alcohol, costs $518.00.  In 14CF589 costs $518 each count and not to possess/consume alcohol.   DNA sample.  AODA and comply.   Not against public interest to dismiss 14CF480 as burden of proof could not be met.  74 days jail credit in 14CF589 and 4 days credit in 14CF557.  $350.00 bond posted in 14CF557 to be applied.  No good time.
plea/sentencing hearing on March 10, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.
Appointed Attorney Peter Masana

Defendant Travis W Kirk in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 14CF480, 14CF557, & 14CF589.  Matters are not resolved.  Atty Masana requested a preliminary hearing be set for all three cases.  Bond remains.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not go on premises where alcohol is sold for on site consumption.  Standard felony conditions.
